isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - REMOVE - DIFFERENTIAL AND CLUTCH PACK ASSEMBLY FROM CARRIER

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL AND CLUTCH PACK ASSEMBLY FROM CARRIER

note.para: If the gear set is to be reused, check tooth contact pattern and ring gear backlash before beginning disassembly. Best overhaul results are obtained when used gearing is adjusted to run in established wear patterns. Omit this step if the gear set is to be replaced.

svcproc.para: When reusing the gear set, remove the left-hand bearing cap, adjuster and lock as a unit. This will help return the gear set to its original adjustment during reassembly.

step1.para: Mount the differential carrier in a repair stand.
Driver-Controlled and Seasonal CTD Only: Remove shift fork seal and spring. Remove expansion plugs, then working at the lower (or small) plug hole, drive out the shift fork shaft ( Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Drive Out Shift Fork Shaft

warning.para: When using a drift, punch or similar tool, wear safety glasses.

step1.para: Driver-Controlled and Seasonal CTD Only: Disengage shift fork yoke from sliding clutch collar. Then remove the clutch collar and shift fork ( Figure 5).

figure.caption: Figure 5. Remove Clutch Collar and Shift Fork

step1.para: If reusing gear set, punch mark bearing adjusters for reference during assembly ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Punch Mark Bearing Adjusters For Reference During Assembly

step1.para: On teeth side of ring gear, cut lockwire and remove bearing cap bolts. Remove cap, adjuster and lock ( Figure 7).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Remove Cap, Adjuster and Lock

step1.para: On back side of ring gear, cut lockwire and remove bearing cap bolts. If the gear set is to be reused, remove bearing cap, adjuster and lock as an assembly ( Figure 8). This will facilitate correct positioning of ring gear during reassembly.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Remove Bearing Cap, Adjuster and Lock

step1.para: Remove bearing cups, then lift ring gear and differential assembly out of carrier ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Lift Ring Gear and Differential Assembly Out of Carrier
